com.paydiant.android.ui.service.transaction

Class ProcessPaymentListenerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paydiant.android.ui.service.transaction.ProcessPaymentListenerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProcessPaymentListener, IProcessSplitPaymentListener

    public class ProcessPaymentListenerAdapter
extends Object
implements IProcessSplitPaymentListener
    This class provides an empty implementation for IProcessSplitPaymentListener. Any classes that wants to use only a subset of the listener methods can override the relevant methods and use it as the interface implementation. 

     ProcessPaymentListenerAdapter processPaymentListenerAdapter = new ProcessPaymentListenerAdapter() {
 
    @Override
    public void onProcessPaymentSuccess(PaymentTransaction paymentTransaction) {
    }
 
    @Override
    public void onProcessPaymentError(PaydiantException e) {
    }
    
 };
 iProcessPaymentService.setProcessPaymentListener(processPaymentListenerAdapter);
    Note: App developers are encouraged to use the ListenerAdapter implementations whenever possible as the Listener interfaces might get updated with new functionality/methods from one SDK release to the other. Therefore using a ListenerAdapter will make sure that there wont be any compilation issues due to unimplemented methods during a SDK upgrade.

    Author:
    Paydiant
